Title.Language: On this day also, the Commemoration of the Martyr Pistavros the New
ÙˆÙ?ÙŠ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø£ÙŠØ¶Ø§Ù‹ ØªØ°ÙƒØ§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‡ÙŠØ¯ ØµÙ„ÙŠØ¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¯ÙŠØ¯

Text.Language: Nimatoi n~te niv/oui: cetaio n~tekmetmarturoc: w~ pimatoi n~te Pi,~rictoc: pia~gioc Pic~tauroc.
O soldier of Christ, St.Â Pistavros, all heavenly hosts honor your martyrdom.
ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ø¬Ù†Ø§Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ ÙŠÙƒØ±Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ø³ØªØ´Ù‡Ø§Ø¯Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø¬Ù†Ø¯ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙŠØ­ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³ ØµÙ„ÙŠØ¨.
P~,oroc n~te nia~poctoloc: nem nip~rov/t/c eucop: cesousou m~mwou e~jen nekm~kauh: e~taksopou e~rok eybe Pi,~rictoc.
The hosts of the Apostles and the prophets together are proud of your sufferings which you accepted for Christ.
Ù„Ø£Ù† ØµÙ?ÙˆÙ? Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£Ù†Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙŠÙ?ØªØ®Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø¢Ù„Ø§Ù…Ùƒ Ø§Ù„ØªÙŠ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ØªÙ‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙŠØ­.

Strong one, Pistavros the martyr, all the ranks of the church praise your struggle. For you stepped forward before the merciless kings, the leaders and the governors and confessed openly in the name of Christ the Lord, saying openly: "I am Christian, and no god is worshiped in the heavens or on earth but Jesus Christ, Son of the living God." Immediately, the adversaries jumped on you because of what was said with your pure mouth. They tortured you severely and tied you with iron shackles and sent you to the city of Cairo. They had you stand before the king, the leaders and the judges, and you confessed openly before them with what your pure mouth uttered and did not forswear. You thought of the saying of the Lord Christ, glory to Him, in His holy gospel, which says: "He who denies me before people, I deny him before My Fatherâ€™s angels in the heavens, and he who confesses Me before people I confess him before My Fatherâ€™s angels in the heavens." When they had you stand before the governor, they immediately ordered your torture. You accepted the suffering, the insults, and the stoning. They displayed you in the open before all the people, with a voice calling before you saying all that your pure mouth confessed, with you leaning with your back against the wood of a cross, mounted high atop a camel, delighted and joyful in the spirit. Come all you people and look at this strong hero riding audaciously, fearing no suffering as they parade him through the streets of Cairo. After they paraded him all over the whole city, they brought him down from the wood of the Cross and severed his holy head with the sword, and he received the crown of martyrdom in the middle of the city. Soon, the merciless ones started a fire and placed upon it your pure body, O great martyr, but the fire did not destroy any of your holy organs. Soon, the faithful earnestly scurried to retrieve your body, O great martyr, and brought it to an inhabited cell. The lord, the father, the patriarch sent it to the rest of the churches and your pure body became a harbor of salvation for all who come to you, as you performed wonder and healings with the power of the Lord Christ, for whose holy name you poured out your blood.

Hail to you O great martyr, Pistavros, for you received what you longed for. You poured out your pure blood in the name of Christ the Lord, glory to Him.

Hail to you O great martyr, Pistavros, for you came in the eleventh hour and were given the wages of the whole day, and were counted among all the pure martyrs.

Blessed and blessed again are you, martyr of Christ, for you won that which no eyes have seen and no ears have heard, and that which had not occurred to a manâ€™s heart.
Ø·ÙˆØ¨Ø§Ùƒ Ø«Ù… Ø·ÙˆØ¨Ø§Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø´Ù‡ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙŠØ­ØŒ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ùƒ Ù?Ø²Øª Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ØªØ±Ù‡ Ø¹ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙ„Ù… ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø£Ø°Ù† ÙˆÙ„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø·Ø± Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ù„Ø¨ Ø¨Ø´Ø±.

Blessed are you great saint, Pistavros the martyr, for you deserved to have the Mother of God, the pure Virgin, St.Â Mary, appear to you and speak with you promising you will receive the martyrdom. She anointed you with oil in the name of her beloved Son. She supported you with her help until you fulfilled your good struggle and were crowned with the crown of martyrdom. For on the holy day, on which her father presented her to the Temple of the Lord, she presented your pure soul crowned with the crowns of martyrdom to her beloved Son.

Today, the children of this church rejoice and sing spiritual hymns, glorifying the Lady, Mother of salvation and praising you, saying: "It is well you came to us today, O the honored body of Pistavros the martyr, bring the revered shrouds, the expensive customs, the aromatic precious oils, and the choice incense and the suitable perfumes to put them all on this pure body which received suffering in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Let us take the organ with us and the ten harps and the rest of the musical instruments to glorify God, Jesus Christ the Logos, and honor His martyr St.Â Barbara, the resplendent, who accepted the sermon and exposed her father, son of Satan, with the power of the King of ages. The wise girl, Barbara the virgin, patiently endured the suffering. And after all that, she completed her struggle on the eighth day of Koiahk and rose to heaven, received the crown of martyrdom, and rejoiced with the hosts of martyrs. We praise her struggle along with King David, the great prophet: "For the King desired her beauty and He is her Lord."

ÙˆÙ„Ù†ÙƒØ±Ù‘Ù?Ù… Ø°Ø§Øª Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ¬Ø§Ù‡Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³Ø© Ø¨Ø±Ø¨Ø§Ø±Ø©ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø°Ø±Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ø§Ù‡Ø±Ø©ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù?ØªØ§Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙƒÙŠÙ…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¯ÙŠÙ…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø±.

she whose father, the adversary, built a bath for her and ordered the overseer of the engineers to make in it two small windows. St.Â Barbara said to the builders to make another small window to represent the Trinity and above the basin of the bath to engrave the sign of the cross. The water in the basin became a source of healing of all diseases. When her father saw the three small windows and the cross, he was angry with his daughter, the wise and quiet one. She fled from him and hid under a boulder. Without pity, he seized her and handed her over to the governor. He ordered she be tortured. As for her, she patiently endured her arduous sufferings. St.Â Barbara accepted the punishment for the sake of Christ, King of the ages, whom she loved. Let us Christians bless her with David the psalmist and cry out, saying: "The King desired your beauty for he is your Lord, and adorned you with every kind of adornment."
